R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades Físicas dos Metais e Ligas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fundição de Metais Ferrosos e Não-Ferrosos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced aerospace system because of their unique combination of high specific strength at both room temperature and moderately elevated temperature, in addition to excellent general corrosion resistance. The research involving the metallic titanium in the Brazilian Aerospace Technical Center (CTA) occurred between 1965 and 1990 aimed to reduce the delay of the Brazilian research in relation to the developed countries. All developed technology was passed to the industry and the works provided the necessary technology of titanium sponge production, placing in the market 14 tons, in a process just available to a closed group of industrialized countries. This work has for objective to rescue the importance of a historical period of the Brazilian metallurgy in the vacuum utilization for the reactive metals production. This work includes the evolution of the research with titanium in the CTA (powder metallurgy) and the current state-of-art of the titanium production in Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Microstructure of Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta Alloy Produced From Hydride Powders

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: III Encontro da SBPMat

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: HENRIQUES, V. A. R.;Henriques, Vinicius André Rodrigues;Henriques, V.A.R.;Henriques, Vinícius André Rodrigues;Henriques, Vinicius A. R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Produtos e Processos Biotecnológicos Vinculados À Saúde Humana Ou dos Animais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta alloy, which has a low modulus of elasticity (55 GPa), can be considered as the best one material to be used as a medical implant. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy eases the obtainment of parts with complex geometry and probably, cheaper. The Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta samples were produced by the sintering of the elementary powders, in vacuum, between 800-1600 C, with heating rate of 20 C/min. All the powders were obtained by HDH process and used in the hydride form, aiming at the reduction of costs and increase of the sintering rate. The objective of this work is the analysis of alloy microstructural evolution from the powders dissolution under the increase of the sintering temperature. For the alloy microstructural characterization, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers microhardness measurements, were used. Density was measured by Archimedes method. In this work an alternative blend (with planetary mill) method was used. The results shows that the blended elemental P/M process is efficient for the alloy production. The samples presented a good densification and adequate microstructure, with complete dissolution of alloying elements in the titanium matrix with the temperature increase.

R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ligas de titânio têm sido usadas no desenvolvimento de dispositivos médicos e dentários devido seus baixos valores de módulo elástico, resistência à corrosão e características de biocompatibilidade. Dentre elas destacam-se aquelas contendo elementos estabilizadores da fase β (Nb, Ta e Zr), como por exemplo, a Ti-35Nb-5Ta-7Zr e Ti-13Nb-13Zr (%-p). Entretanto, poucas informações foram encontradas na literatura sobre ligas Ti-Nb. É importante ser ressaltada a importância do uso de nióbio no âmbito nacional. Este trabalho tem o objetivo de apresentar resultados sobre a preparação da liga Nb-40Ti (%-p) através da consolidação por prensagem a quente de pós-moídos por 30h. Misturas de pós Nb+Ti e Nb+TiH2 foram usadas para a preparação da liga Nb-40Ti (%-p). A etapa de moagem foi realizada em um moinho de bolas planetário sob atmosfera de argônio, usando uma velocidade de 150rpm, esferas de 10mm de diâmetro de aço endurecido e uma relação de massas esferas/pós de 10:1. O processo de consolidação por prensagem a quente sob vácuo foi feita a 200MPa por 1h, mediante níveis de pressão de 200 MPa. Amostras dos pós-moídos e dos produtos consolidados foram caracterizadas com o auxílio de técnicas de difração de raios X (XRD), microscopia eletrônica de varredura (MEV) e microanálises via EDX. Picos de Nb e Ti estão ainda presentes em pós-moídos por 30h, indicando que o processo de mechanical alloying não foi atingido e que regiões ricas em Ti podem estar presentes. Uma pequena quantidade de poros foi observada nas microestruturas das ligas Nb-40Ti após prensagem a quente a 1200-1400oC. As amostras Nb+Ti prensadas (200MPa) a 1200oC por 1h indicaram a presença de colônias ricas em titânio, indicando que o mesmo não foi completamente dissolvido. Após prensagem a 1400oC por 1h, a homogeneidade química e microestrutural foi atingida. Ligas Nb-40Ti preparadas a partir de hidreto de titânio apresentaram menores tamanhos de grãos do que aquelas moídas com o metal. Foi observada a form

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fundição de Metais Ferrosos e Não-Ferrosos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
As ligas de titânio se destacam entre os materiais para utilização em próteses ortopédicas por
apresentarem elevada relação resistência mecânica / peso, boa resistência à corrosão e elevada
biocompatibilidade. Dentre as ligas à base de titânio para aplicações biomédicas, a principal é a Ti-
6Al-4V. No entanto, pesquisas recentes mostram que os elementos Al e V podem causar efeitos
citotóxicos. O nióbio, junto com o titânio, o zircônio e o tântalo formam o grupo dos quatro elementos
metálicos considerados mais inertes. Dentre esses metais, o nióbio é o único que quando adicionado
ao titânio possui a capacidade de reduzir o módulo de elasticidade, tornando-o essencial na obtenção
de novas ligas de titânio para implantes ortopédicos. O processamento de ligas de titânio por
metalurgia do pó (M/P) a partir dos pós elementares, mostra-se uma alternativa viável, pois permite a
obtenção de peças com geometrias complexas e próximas às dimensões finais ("near-net shape)
possivelmente a custos mais acessíveis. Neste trabalho amostras da liga Ti-10%Nb foram obtidas
pela técnica de mistura dos pós elementares, usando pós provenientes do processo de
hidrogenação-desidrogenação (HDH), seguido de uma seqüência de prensagem uniaxial a frio,
prensagem isostática a frio e sinterização em vácuo. Foi observada a evolução microestrutural da liga
por meio de microscopia eletrônica de varredura. O trabalho é complementado por medidas de
microdureza e determinação da massa específica. As análises preliminares dos resultados mostraram
alta densificação e microestrutura adequada.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades Físicas dos Metais e Ligas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Entre as ligas de titânio desenvolvidas para a aplicação em implantes, a de composição Ti-13Nb-13Zr se destaca das demais por apresentar baixo módulo de elasticidade, elevada resistência mecânica e superior biocompatibilidade. A metalurgia do pó permite a obtenção de peças próximas ao formato final e estruturas com porosidade controlada. Amostras da liga foram prensadas isostaticamente a frio e sinterizadas de 900 a 1400 °C, em vácuo, para o estudo do desenvolvimento microestrutural. A seguir, foram sinterizadas amostras a 1400 °C, em 3 níveis de porosidade, visando conferir propriedades adequadas para uma boa osseointegração de implantes. Após a sinterização, as amostras foram caracterizadas com o auxílio de microscopia eletrônica de varredura, difração de raios X e medidas de microdureza Vickers e densidade. As amostras sinterizadas apresentaram homogeneidade microestrutural e níveis de porosidade que variaram principalmente com a pressão de compactação a frio.

A metalurgia do pó permite a obtenção de peças próximas ao formato final e estruturas com porosidade controlada. Amostras da liga foram prensadas isostaticamente a frio e sinterizadas de 900 a 1400 °C, em vácuo, para o estudo do desenvolvimento microestrutural. Após a sinterização, as amostras foram caracterizadas com o auxílio de microscopia eletrônica de varredura, difração de raios X e medidas de microdureza Vickers e densidade. DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 63º Congresso Anual da ABM ? Crescimento Sustentável

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Uma técnica para aumentar a vida útil e a temperatura de trabalho de palhetas de turbinas de aeronaves e termoelétricas é a utilização de revestimentos cerâmicos especiais (TBC) sobre um substrato metálico aplicados por deposição física de vapores por feixe de elétrons (EB-PVD). Os materiais mais utilizados para esse fim são as cerâmicas de zircõnia dopadas com ítria. O objetivo desse trabalho é investigar a adição de nióbia como co-dopante nessas cerâmicas visando reduzir a condutividade térmica e melhorar as propriedades mecânicas dos revestimentos. Neste trabalho são apresentados resultados de análises das fases presentes por difração de raios-X de misturas de pós de zircônia com teores de 5-10% de ítria e 5 a 25% de nióbia sinterizadas a 1700°C/1h e inclui caracterização microestrutural das amostras. Os resultados indicam a viabilidade da utilização da rota com a obtenção de uma estrutura monofásica.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Uma técnica para aumentar a vida útil e a temperatura de trabalho de palhetas de turbinas de aeronaves e termoelétricas é a utilização de revestimentos cerâmicos especiais (TBC) sobre um substrato metálico aplicados por deposição física de vapores por feixe de elétrons (EB-PVD). Os materiais mais utilizados para esse fim são as cerâmicas de zircõnia dopadas com ítria. O objetivo desse trabalho é investigar a adição de nióbia como co-dopante nessas cerâmicas visando reduzir a condutividade térmica e melhorar as propriedades mecânicas dos revestimentos. Neste trabalho são apresentados resultados de análises das fases presentes por difração de raios-X de misturas de pós de zircônia com teores de 5-10% de ítria e 5 a 25% de nióbia sinterizadas a 1700°C/1h e inclui caracterização microestrutural das amostras. Os resultados indicam a viabilidade da utilização da rota com a obtenção de uma estrutura monofásica.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ICAM 2009 - 11th International Conference on Advanced Materials
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 11th International Conference on Advanced Materials - ICAM 2009

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The research of artificial materials for implants has assumed an important role in the implants development. The trend of the current research in orthopedic implants is based in the development of titanium alloys with low modulus of elasticity, close to the bone, and toxic elements free. Powder metallurgy is an advantageous alternative for titanium parts production with complex geometries at a relative low cost. In this work, the near beta Ti-13Nb-13Zr alloy was obtained from hydrided powders. Samples were produced by mixing of initial hydrided powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 900 up to 1400 C, in vacuum. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure and microhardness by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation, respectively. Density was measured by water immersion method and the sintering behavior was studied by means of dilatometry. The interstitial contents were analised by Leco equipment. The results indicate that the homogenization of the alloy is diffusion-controlled. The alloy homogenization takes place at high temperatures after the dissolution of niobium particles and a microstructure consisting of coarse plate-like alpha and intergranular beta is obtained.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 11th International Conference on Advanced Materials - ICAM 2009

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: TiN is a typical coating used to improve the wear properties of Ti alloys in aerospace, machining and implant applications. Electron Beam Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD) is a form of deposition in which a target anode is bombarded with an electron beam given off by a charged tungsten filament under high vacuum, producing a thin film in a substrate. In this work, microstructural results of the TiN films, deposited using titanium targets and Ti-13Nb-13Zr substrates, both produced by powder metallurgy, were obtained. Targets and substrates were produced by mixing of initial metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by vacuum sintering. Sintered samples and TiN layers were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation and wear test. TiN films produced presented high hardness values, a continuous and columnar structure, large thickness and low friction coefficient.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: TiN is a typical coating used to improve the wear properties of Ti alloys in aerospace, machining and implant applications. Electron Beam Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD) is a form of deposition in which a target anode is bombarded with an electron beam given off by a charged tungsten filament under high vacuum, producing a thin film in a substrate. In this work, microstructural results of the TiN films, deposited using titanium targets and Ti-13Nb-13Zr substrates, both produced by powder metallurgy, were obtained. Targets and substrates were produced by mixing of initial metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by vacuum sintering. Sintered samples and TiN layers were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation and wear test. TiN films produced presented high hardness values, a continuous and columnar structure, large thickness and low friction coefficient.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 62° ABM Congress

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titânio e suas ligas são muito utilizados no setor aeroespacial devido principalmente a sua elevada relação resistência mecânica/peso e excelente resistência à corrosão. As pesquisas envolvendo a obtenção de titânio metálico no Centro Técnico Aeroespacial (CTA) foram realizadas entre 1965 e 1990 e visavam reduzir a distância da pesquisa brasileira em relação aos paises desenvolvidos. Toda tecnologia desenvolvida foi repassada para a iniciativa privada. Os trabalhos realizados tornaram o Brasil auto-suficiente na tecnologia de produção de esponja de titânio, colocando no mercado brasileiro mais de 14 toneladas do produto, num processo só disponível a um fechado grupo de países industrializados. Este trabalho tem por objetivo resgatar a importância de um período histórico da metalurgia brasileira destacadamente na utilização, pioneira no país, da vacuometalurgia para o refino de metais e obtenção de ligas metálicas reativas e inclui a evolução dos trabalhos atuais envolvendo titânio no CTA (metalurgia do pó) e o atual estado-da-arte da obtenção do titânio e suas ligas no Brasil.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced aerospace system because of their unique combination of high specific strength at both room temperature and moderately elevated temperature, in addition to excellent general corrosion resistance. The research involving the metallic titanium in the Brazilian Aerospace Technical Center (CTA) occurred between 1965 and 1990, aiming to reduce the delay of the Brazilian research in relation to the developed countries. All developed technology was tranfered to the industry and the works provided the necessary technology of titanium sponge production, placing in the market more than14 tons, in a process just available to a closed group of industrialized countries. This work has for objective to rescue the importance of a historical period of the Brazilian metallurgy in the vacuum utilization for the reactive metals production. This work includes the evolution of the research with titanium in the CTA (powder metallurgy) and the current state-of-art of the titanium production in Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evaluation of sintering parameters of TiH2/b-TCP composites for development of bioactive implants
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Evaluation of sintering parameters of TiH2/b-TCP composites for development of bioactive implants

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology, PTECH 2011
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology,

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Powder metallurgy is an effective technique to manufacture bioactive implants through the
development of composites titanium/calcium phosphates. These materials have the advantage to associate strength and bioactivity, thus favoring the osseointegration. This study aimed to determine the parameters for sintering mixtures of TiH2 with 5 and 10% b-TCP. TiH2 powder was provided by the Aerospace Technology Center - Brazil. The b-TCP powder was synthesized in the laboratory by the technique of dissolution/precipitation and had particle size below 180 nm. The mixtures were performed in an attrition mill for 5 hours, dried in a rotary evaporator, and then compressed at 150 MPa. The sintering parameters were evaluated by thermal analysis and X-ray diffraction. Pure TiH2 showed complete sintering above 900 oC in argon atmosphere. The analysis showed the need to perform a controlled sintering for intermediate reactions, improving the mixture sintering. Thus, the sintering parameters were as follows: heating 5 oC/min, maintaining 10 minutes at 480 oC and 650 oC for subsequent sintering at 1200 oC for 2 hour. X-ray analyses showed that the sintering lead to the formation of pure titanium for TiH2 and Ti, TixPy, TiO2 and CaTiO3 for the composites.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Microstructural comparison of TiH2/calcium phosphates composites sintered in vacuum and in argon
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Microstructural comparison of TiH2/calcium phosphates composites sintered in vacuum and in argon

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Many studies have shown the possibility of manufacturing bioactive implants through the
development of composite titanium / calcium phosphate by powder metallurgy. These materials have the advantage to associate strength and bioactivity, favoring the osseointegration. The present study aimed to compare the microstructure of titanium / calcium phosphate composites obtained by sintering in argon atmosphere and vacuum. The composites were prepared by mixtures containing TiH2 with 5 and 10% in volume of b-TCP. TiH2 powder was provided by the Aerospace Technology Center - Brazil. The b-TCP powder was synthesized in the laboratory by the technique of dissolution / precipitation with particle size below 180 nm. The mixtures were performed in an attrition mill for 5 hours, dried in a rotary evaporator and compressed at 150 MPa. The samples were sintered at 1200 oC for 2 hours with a heating rate of 5 oC/min. X-ray analyses showed that the composites were composed by Ti, TixPy, TiO2 and CaTiO3 phases after sintering in argon, and Ti, TixPy and CaTiO3 phases after sintering in vacuum.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Many studies have shown the possibility of manufacturing bioactive implants through the
development of composite titanium / calcium phosphate by powder metallurgy. These materials have the advantage to associate strength and bioactivity, favoring the osseointegration. The present study aimed to compare the microstructure of titanium / calcium phosphate composites obtained by sintering in argon atmosphere and vacuum. The composites were prepared by mixtures containing TiH2 with 5 and 10% in volume of b-TCP. TiH2 powder was provided by the Aerospace Technology Center - Brazil. The b-TCP powder was synthesized in the laboratory by the technique of dissolution / precipitation with particle size below 180 nm. The mixtures were performed in an attrition mill for 5 hours, dried in a rotary evaporator and compressed at 150 MPa. The samples were sintered at 1200 oC for 2 hours with a heating rate of 5 oC/min. X-ray analyses showed that the composites were composed by Ti, TixPy, TiO2 and CaTiO3 phases after sintering in argon, and Ti, TixPy and CaTiO3 phases after sintering in vacuum.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: TiN/ZrN Multilayer PVD Coatings on Titanium Alloys Produced by Powder Metallurgy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: TiN/ZrN Multilayer PVD Coatings on Titanium Alloys Produced by Powder Metallurgy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Multilayer coatings are synthetic structures constituted by alternate layers of
different materials. The technological applications of the multilayer coatings can
involve optical, electromagnetism and wear areas. The target of this work is the
production of multilayer TiN/ZrN coatings by Electron Beam Physical Vapor
Deposition (EB-PVD) over titanium alloys produced by powder metallurgy. P/M-Ti-
35Nb-7Zr-5Ta cylindrical samples used as substrates were produced by mixing of the
elemental powders with subsequent cold pressing steps and sintering at 1400ºC, in high
vacuum. TiN/ZrN coatings were obtained by evaporation of alternating Ti and Zr
cylindrical targets. The multilayers were characterized by optical and scanning electron
microscopy (SEM), chemical analysis via energy dispersive spectrometry (EDS) and
Vickers indentation. Besides the possibility of obtaining several layers, the results show
coatings with coherent columnar structure, low discontinuity, large and homogenous
thickness and high adhesion to substrate.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
During the recent years, alloys based on the intermetallic compound TiAl have attracted a
considerable interest as potential competitors to steels and superalloys. Gamma-TiAl alloys are potential replacements for nickel and conventional titanium alloys in hot sections of turbine engines, as well as in orbital platform vehicles. The alloy design and efficient routes of TiAl processing are important technological challenges. Powder metallurgy is a near net shape process that allows the parts production with complex geometry at low costs. In this work, samples of Ti-48Al-2Cr-2Nb (at.%) were prepared from elemental and pre-alloyed powders mixed for 2 h, followed by cold uniaxial and isostatic pressing and sintered between 800 up to 1400ºC, for 1 h, under vacuum. After metallographic preparation, sintered samples were characterized by SEM (Scanning Electron Microscopy), density analyses and Vickers microhardness measurements. The results indicated the viability of the pre-alloyed route and the tendency of a full lamellar microstructure of alternating gamma and α2 phases in high sintering temperatures.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The present work reports on the structural evaluation of mechanically alloyed Ti-xZr-
22Si-11B (x = 5, 7, 10, 15 and 20 at-%) powders. Milled powders and hot-pressed alloys were
characterized by X-ray diffraction, electron scanning microscopy, and electron dispersive
spectrometry. The Si and B atoms were preferentially dissolved into the Ti and Zr lattices during
ball milling of Ti-xZr-22Si-11B (x = 7, 10, 15 and 20 at-%) powders, and extended solid solutions
were achieved. The displacement of Ti peaks was more pronounced to the direction of lower
diffraction angles with increasing Zr amounts in mechanically alloyed Ti-Zr-Si-B powders,
indicating that the Zr atoms were also dissolved into the Ti lattice.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work discusses on the preparation of Ni-45Ti-5Mo, Ni-40Ti-10Mo and Ni-46Ti-
2Mo-2Zr (at-%) alloys by high-energy ball milling and hot pressing, which are potentially attractive for dental and medical applications. The milling process was performed in stainless steel balls (19mm diameter) and vials (225 mL) using a rotary speed of 300rpm and a ball-to-powder weight ratio of 10:1. Hot pressing under vacuum was performed in a BN-coated graphite crucible at 900oC for 1 h using a load of 20 MPa. The milled and hot-pressed materials were characterized by X-ray diffraction, electron scanning microscopy, and electron dispersive spectrometry. Peaks of B2-NiTi and Ni4Ti3 were identified in XRD patterns of Ni-45Ti-5Mo, Ni-40Ti-10Mo and Ni-46Ti-2Mo-2Zr powders milled for 1h. The NiTi compound dissolved small Mo amounts lower than 4 at%, which were measured by EDS analysis. Moreover, it was identified the existence of an unknown Mo-rich phase in microstructures of the hot-pressed Ni-Ti-Mo alloys.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Eighth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The use of hydride powders in titanium powder metallurgy (P/M) is a low cost alternative
for the manufacture of titanium alloys. However, due to the high reactivity of these powders, parts produced using this technique may contain interstitial impurities such as oxygen, nitrogen and carbon. In this work a factorial design approach was used to evaluate the influence of some stages of P/M upon the levels of these elements in sintered samples of Ti-6Al-4V. Milling time of titanium hydride powders, sintering temperature and holding time were evaluated. The effect of milling time was detected as the most significant for the increase in oxygen levels. The contents of all elements were affected by the increase of sintering temperature from 1200 °C to 1400 ºC. Holding time was shown to be significant only for the carbon absorption in the samples sintered at 1400 °C.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium nitride (TiN) is a hard material, often used as coating to improve the wear properties of titanium alloys in machining, implant and aerospace applications. Electron Beam Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD) is a technique which a target anode is bombarded with an electron beam given off by a charged tungsten filament under high vacuum, producing a thin film in a substrate. In this work, results of TiN films depositions on Ti-13Nb-13Zr substrates by EB-PVD are studied. Titanium targets were obtained by a purified ingot and the substrates produced by powder metallurgy. Sintered samples of Ti-13Nb-13Zr and TiN layers were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, Vickers microhardness and wear tests. The TiN films presented high hardness values, continuity and large thickness. The coatings improved the tribological properties of the substrate due to high adhesion and low wear rate.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium nitride (TiN) is a hard material, often used as coating to improve the wear properties of titanium alloys in machining, implant and aerospace applications. Electron Beam Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD) is a technique which a target anode is bombarded with an electron beam given off by a charged tungsten filament under high vacuum, producing a thin film in a substrate. In this work, results of TiN films depositions on Ti-13Nb-13Zr substrates by EB-PVD are studied. Titanium targets were obtained by a purified ingot and the substrates produced by powder metallurgy. Sintered samples of Ti-13Nb-13Zr and TiN layers were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, Vickers microhardness and wear tests. The TiN films presented high hardness values, continuity and large thickness. The coatings improved the tribological properties of the substrate due to high adhesion and low wear rate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Interstitial Control in Titanium Alloys Produced by Powder Metallurgy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The titanium alloys are used for applications that demand high performance, including
surgical implants and aerospace applications. Powder metallurgy is an advantageous alternative for titanium parts production with complex geometries at a relative low cost. Despite that, it is verified that the introduction of interstitial elements (oxygen, nitrogen and carbon) wile processing these alloys, though can increase hardness and mechanical resistance, which is frequently related to the reduction of ductility and fragility increase. The objective of this work is to investigate the influence of the interstitial elements in commercially pure Ti and Ti-13Nb-13Zr alloy produced by powder metallurgy (P/M). Samples were produced by the mixing of hydrided metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering at 1400 °C, in vacuum. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure and microhardness by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation, respectively. The interstitial content was analised by Leco equipment. It was shown that the samples were sintered to high densities with a Widmanstatten microstructure. The oxygen and nitrogen contents are above the ELI (Extra Low Interstitial) and the critical issues were identified in the original blended elemental route.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Titanium Nitride Deposition in Titanium Implant Alloys Produced by Powder Metallurgy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Titanium nitride (TiN) is an extremely hard material, often used as a coating on titanium
alloy, steel, carbide, and aluminum components to improve wear resistance. Electron Beam
Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD) is a form of deposition in which a target anode is bombarded with an electron beam given off by a charged tungsten filament under high vacuum, producing a thin film in a substrate. In this work are presented results of TiN deposition in targets and substrates of Ti (C.P.) and Ti-13Nb-13Zr obtained by powder metallurgy. Samples were produced by mixing of hydrided metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 900°C up to 1400 °C, in vacuum. The deposition was carried out under nitrogen atmosphere. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure and microhardness by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation, respectively. It was shown that the samples were sintered to high densities and presented homogeneous microstructure, with ideal characteristics for an adequate deposition and adherence. The film layer presented a continuous structure with 15μm.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ti-13Nb-13Zr Production for Implant Applications
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Ti-13Nb-13Zr Production for Implant Applications

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology - PTECH-2009
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Powder metallurgy (P/M) of titanium alloys may lead to the obtainment of components
having weak-to-absent textures, uniform grain structure and higher homogeneity compared with conventional wrought products. The production of the Ti-13Nb-13Zr alloy by P/M starting from blended elemental (BE) powders is a cost-effective route considering its versatility and also for allowing the manufacture of complex parts. This alloy due its high biocompatibility and lower modulus of elasticity is a promising candidate for implants fabrication. Samples were produced by mixing of initial metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering in order to identify the microstructural evolution. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure, microhardness and density. The surface topography of the samples was studied by means of atomic force microscopy (AFM). It was shown that the route is adequate to reach high densities with homogeneous microstructure. Representative AFM images allowed distinguishing a lamellar structure caused by the different phases that are present in the surface of the specimens.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Isochronal Sintering of Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta alloy is considered an attractive material for implants manufacture due
to an excellent combination of properties, including high mechanical and corrosion resistance, beyond the lowest elastic modulus among the titanium alloys. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy (P/M) eases the obtainment of parts with near-net shape forming and low production costs. Samples were produced by mixing of initial metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 800-1600 °C, in vacuum. The isochronal sintering demonstrated to be efficient for the study of the microstructural evolution. The samples presented high densification and adequate microstructure. The results show that a betahomogeneous microstructure is obtained in the whole sample extension when sintered at high temperatures beyond that P/M technology allows an effective porosity control.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Microstructural evolution of Ti-10Nb and Ti-15Nb alloys produced by the blended elemental technique
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Microstructural evolution of Ti-10Nb and Ti-15Nb alloys produced by the blended elemental technique

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology - PTECH-2009
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Seventh International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Alfa/beta titanium alloys have been intensely used for aerospace and biomedical
applications. Production of powder metallurgy titanium alloys components may lead to a
reduction in the cost of parts, compared to those produced by conventional cast and wrought (ingot metallurgy) processes, because additional working operations (machining, turning, milling, etc.) and material waste can be avoided. In this work, samples of Ti- 10, 15Nb (weight%) alloys were obtained by the blended elemental technique using hydride-dehydride (HDH) powders as raw material, followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering carried out in the range 900?1500 ºC. These alloys were characterized by X-ray diffractometry for phase composition, scanning electron microscopy for microstructure, Vickers indentation for hardness, Archimedes method for specific mass and resonance ultrasound device for elastic modulus. For the samples sintered at 1500ºC it was identified a and b phases. It was observed the influence of the sintering temperatures on the final microstructure. With increasing sintering temperature, microstructure homogenization of the alloy takes place and at 1500 ºC this process is complete. The same behavior is observed for densification. Comparing to the Ti6Al4V alloy properties, these alloys hardness (sintered at 1500 ºC) are near and elastic modulus are 18% less.

These alloys were characterized by X-ray diffractometry for phase composition, scanning electron microscopy for microstructure, Vickers indentation for hardness, Archimedes method for specific mass and resonance ultrasound device for elastic modulus. For the samples sintered at 1500ºC it was identified a and b phases. It was observed the influence of the sintering temperatures on the final microstructure. With increasing sintering temperature, microstructure homogenization of the alloy takes place and at 1500 ºC this process is complete. The same behavior is observed for densification. Comparing to the Ti6Al4V alloy properties, these alloys hardness (sintered at 1500 ºC) are near and elastic modulus are 18% less.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Techniques for Ti-6Al-4V production by Powder Metallurgy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Techniques for Ti-6Al-4V production by Powder Metallurgy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of XX SAE Brasil International Congress and Exhibition

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced systems because of their unique combination of high specific and corrosion resistance. Ti-6Al-4V is the most important titanium alloy and its application ranges from aerospace to surgical implants. Despite these attractive features, use of titanium alloys is limited by cost. The alloys processing by powder metallurgy ease the obtainment of parts with complex geometry and probably, cheaper. In this work, new routes of Ti-6Al-4V production by powder metallurgy are investigated. Samples were produced by mixing of initial metallic powders followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 900-1400 °C, in vacuum. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure and microhardness by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation, respectively. Density was measured by Archimedes method. It was shown that the samples were sintered to high densities and presented homogeneous microstructure. Due the complete dissolution of the alloying elements in the titanium matrix, a good combination of microstructure, mechanical properties and densification could be reached.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced systems because of their unique combination of high specific and corrosion resistance. Ti-6Al-4V is the most important titanium alloy and its application ranges from aerospace to surgical implants. Despite these attractive features, use of titanium alloys is limited by cost. Sintered samples were characterized for phase composition, microstructure and microhardness by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy and Vickers indentation, respectively. Density was measured by Archimedes method. It was shown that the samples were sintered to high densities and presented homogeneous microstructure. Due the complete dissolution of the alloying elements in the titanium matrix, a good combination of microstructure, mechanical properties and densification could be reached.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Densification of titanium alloys obtained by powder metallurgy

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced aerospace systems, chemical and naval applications and surgical implants because of its high strength-to-weight ratio, high resistance to many corrosive environments, and can be used over a wide range of temperatures. Powder metallurgy of titanium and Ti-based alloys may lead to the obtainment of components having weak-to-absent textures, uniform grain structure and higher homogeneity compared with conventional wrought products. In this work results of the densification of Ti-6Al-4V, Ti-6Al-7Nb and Ti-13Nb-13Zr alloys after cold and isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 900-1400°C using hydride titanium powders are presented. The samples were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, Vickers indentation and density measurements. The results showed a higher densification with increasing sintering temperature, densification levels above 90% and the importance of using hydrided titanium powder in the final porosity.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium alloys parts are ideally suited for advanced aerospace systems, chemical and naval applications and surgical implants because of its high strength-to-weight ratio, high resistance to many corrosive environments, and can be used over a wide range of temperatures. Powder metallurgy of titanium and Ti-based alloys may lead to the obtainment of components having weak-to-absent textures, uniform grain structure and higher homogeneity compared with conventional wrought products. In this work results of the densification of Ti-6Al-4V, Ti-6Al-7Nb and Ti-13Nb-13Zr alloys after cold and isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering between 900-1400°C using hydride titanium powders are presented. The samples were characterized by X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, Vickers indentation and density measurements. The results showed a higher densification with increasing sintering temperature, densification levels above 90% and the importance of using hydrided titanium powder in the final porosity.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The objective of this work was investigate the niobia addition like codoped in ceramic coatings to
decrease the thermal conductivity and mechanical properties of the coatings. In this article were showed results of the phases presents analysis by X Ray Diffraction from zirconia powder mixture with content of 5-10 wt% yttria and 5-25 wt% niobia sintered to 1700 ºC for 1 hour and the microstructural characterization of the samples. The results show the viability in the utilization of this rote to obtain the monophase structure.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The most usual ceramic material for coating turbine blades is yttria doped zirconia. Addition of niobia, as a co-dopant in the Y2O3-ZrO2 system, can reduce the thermal conductivity and improve mechanical properties of the coating. The purpose of this work is to evaluate the influence of the addition of niobia on the microstructure and thermal properties of the ceramic coatings. SEM on coatings fractured cross-section shows a columnar structure and the results of XRD show only zirconia tetragonal phase in the ceramic coating for the chemical composition range studied. As the difference NbO2.5-YO1.5 mol percent increases, the tetragonality increases. A significant reduction of the thermal conductivity, measured by laser flash technique, in the zirconia coating codoped with yttria and niobia when compared with zirconia-yttria coating was observed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The most usual ceramic material for coating turbine blades is yttria doped zirconia. Addition of niobia, as a co-dopant in the Y2O3-ZrO2 system, can reduce the thermal conductivity and improve mechanical properties of the coating. SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Shape Memory Alloys (SMA) are novel materials which have the ability to return to a predetermined shape when heated. SMA are useful as actuators which are materials that change shape, stiffness, position, natural frequency, and other mechanical characteristics in response to temperature or electromagnetic fields. Applications include engines in cars and airplanes, electrical generators and surgical implants that make use of the mechanical energy resulting from the shape transformations. Powder metallurgy (P/M) allows the SMA production with savings of energy and time and with higher microstructural homogeneity than those obtained by conventional processes. In this work a new nickel-free titanium alloy Ti-22Nb-6Zr (%at) was produced in order to expand the application field of SMA .
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Shape Memory Alloys (SMA) are novel materials which have the ability to return to a predetermined shape when heated. SMA are useful as actuators which are materials that change shape, stiffness, position, natural frequency, and other mechanical characteristics in response to temperature or electromagnetic fields. Powder metallurgy (P/M) allows the SMA production with savings of energy and time and with higher microstructural homogeneity than those obtained by conventional processes. In this work a new nickel-free titanium alloy Ti-22Nb-6Zr (%at) was produced in order to expand the application field of SMA .

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A liga Ni-Ti é um material promissor na área biomédica devido à amplitude da aplicação do efeito de memória de forma e superelasticidade em válvulas e dispositivos cirúrgicos. Atualmente, peças porosas de ligas Ni-Ti vêm sendo de grande interesse para utilização como biomateriais, principalmente para substituição de tecidos duros por apresentar melhor osteointegração. Nesse estudo foi produzido a liga Ti-50,8 at.%Ni a partir de pós de titânio hidrogenado (TiH2) e níquel metálico. Os pós foram misturados durante 90 minutos e posteriormente submetidos à prensagem uniaxial por meio de prensa hidráulica, seguido de prensagem isostática a frio, a uma pressão de 450 MPa. Posteriormente, as amostras foram sinterizadas a vácuo em temperaturas de 1000 a 1200ºC, durante 60 minutos. Foi utilizada a técnica de Microscopia Eletrônica de Varredura (MEV) para acompanhar o desenvolvimento microestrutural da liga. Para avaliar as possíveis fases secundárias, estáveis e metaestáveis existentes após o processo de sinterização, foram realizadas análises de difração de raios X (DRX).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A liga Ni-Ti é um material promissor na área biomédica devido à amplitude da aplicação do efeito de memória de forma e superelasticidade em válvulas e dispositivos cirúrgicos. SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium alloys are considered an attractive material for the production of implants due to an excellent combination of properties, including high mechanical and corrosion resistance, high biocompatibility and low elastic modulus. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy eases the obtainment of parts with near-net shape and low production costs. Despite these excellent properties, the use of titanium implants is restricted to non-tribological applications due to the high friction coefficient and low resistance to wear. One way to overcome this problem is to use a multilayer coating that combines the properties of several materials. In this work, substrates of two titanium alloys developed specifically for surgical implants (Ti-13Nb-13Zr and Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta) were produced by mixing of the elemental powders with subsequent cold pressing stages and sintering in high vacuum. TiN/ZrN multilayer coatings were obtained by Electron Beam Physical Vapor Deposition (EB-PVD). The samples were characterized by optical and scanning electron microscopy (SEM), chemical analysis via energy dispersive spectrometry (EDS) and Vickers indentation. The substrates presented high densification and adequate microstructure. It was possible to produce several layers and coatings with coherent columnar structure, low discontinuity, large and homogenous thickness and high adhesion to the substrates.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium alloys are considered an attractive material for the production of implants due to an excellent combination of properties, including high mechanical and corrosion resistance, high biocompatibility and low elastic modulus. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy eases the obtainment of parts with near-net shape and low production costs. Despite these excellent properties, the use of titanium implants is restricted to non-tribological applications due to the high friction coefficient and low resistance to wear. One way to overcome this problem is to use a multilayer coating that combines the properties of several materials. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Microstructural Characterization of Ti6Al-2Sn-4Zr-2Mo alloy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of Euromat 2013

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Turbine blades for airplanes work in adverse conditions, under corrosive environment and high temperatures and pressure conditions. Ti-6Al-2Sn-4Zr-2Mo alloy was developed for high temperatures applications in aerospace area. In this work, Ti-6Al-2Sn-4Zr-2Mo alloy was obtained by powder metallurgy using titanium hydride powders. Samples were manufactured by blended elemental method from a sequence of uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering among 800 up to 1400°C, in vacuum. The objective of this work is the analysis of microstrutural evolution from the use of arc melting process. The alloy was characterized by scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction and Vickers microhardness measurement. Density was measured by Archimedes method. The results show that an α+β (Widmanstätten) homogenous microstructure is obtained in the whole sample extension from the dissolution of molybdenum areas
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Turbine blades for airplanes work in adverse conditions, under corrosive environment and high temperatures and pressure conditions. Ti-6Al-2Sn-4Zr-2Mo alloy was developed for high temperatures applications in aerospace area. In this work, Ti-6Al-2Sn-4Zr-2Mo alloy was obtained by powder metallurgy using titanium hydride powders. Samples were manufactured by blended elemental method from a sequence of uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing with subsequent densification by sintering among 800 up to 1400°C, in vacuum. The objective of this work is the analysis of microstrutural evolution from the use of arc melting process. The alloy was characterized by scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction and Vickers microhardness measurement. Density was measured by Archimedes method. The results show that an α+β (Widmanstätten) homogenous microstructure is obtained in the whole sample extension from the dissolution of molybdenum areas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: During the last years, alloys based on the intermetallic compound TiAl have attracted a considerable interest as potential competitors to steels and superalloys. Intermetallic Gamma-TiAl alloys are potential replacements for nickel and conventional titanium alloys in hot sections of turbine engines, as well as in orbital platform vehicles. The alloy design and efficient routes of TiAl processing are important technological challenges. Powder metallurgy is a near net shape process that allows the parts production with complex geometry at low costs. In this work, samples of Ti-48Al-2Cr-2Nb (at.%) were produced by arc melting and powder metallurgy from pre-alloyed Ti-Al powders. Samples were characterized by XRD (X-ray diffraction), SEM (Scanning Electron Microscopy), EDS (Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy) and Vickers microhardness measurements. The results indicated the viability of the both routes and the tendency of a lamellar microstructure of alternating gamma and alpha-2 phases.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: During the last years, alloys based on the intermetallic compound TiAl have attracted a considerable interest as potential competitors to steels and superalloys. Intermetallic Gamma-TiAl alloys are potential replacements for nickel and conventional titanium alloys in hot sections of turbine engines, as well as in orbital platform vehicles. The alloy design and efficient routes of TiAl processing are important technological challenges. Powder metallurgy is a near net shape process that allows the parts production with complex geometry at low costs. In this work, samples of Ti-48Al-2Cr-2Nb (at.%) were produced by arc melting and powder metallurgy from pre-alloyed Ti-Al powders. Samples were characterized by XRD (X-ray diffraction), SEM (Scanning Electron Microscopy), EDS (Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy) and Vickers microhardness measurements. The results indicated the viability of the both routes and the tendency of a lamellar microstructure of alternating gamma and alpha-2 phases.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de produtos de minerais não-metálicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O diboreto de zircônio (ZrB2) é um material que lidera a categoria de cerâmicas de ultra-alta temperatura devido suas propriedades únicas, dentre elas o seu elevado ponto de fusão (3245 °C) e baixa densidade em relação aos demais materiais desta categoria (6,09 g/cm3). Estas propriedades o tornam um potencial candidato para aplicação em sistemas de barreira térmica em veículos hipersônicos e de reentrada atmosférica. Neste trabalho, foi avaliado o efeito da adição de carbeto de silício (SiC) na sinterização sem pressão do ZrB2. Foram preparadas misturas com concentrações em volume de 10, 20 e 30 % de SiC. A mistura foi realizada em moinho planetário com esferas de SiC por 4 h em álcool isopropílico. Foram realizadas duas sinterizações, uma a 1900 ºC/1h e outra a 2000 °C /1h. A adição de SiC proporcionou um aumento na densificação com o aumento de sua concentração na amostra. As amostras sinterizadas a 1900 ºC apresentaram densificação máxima de 90 %DT para as amostras com 30 %vol de SiC. Ao passo que as amostras sinterizadas a 2000 ºC proporcionaram uma densificação de 82,5 a 91,0 %DT para amostras sem SiC e com 30 %vol. de SiC, respectivamente.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: O diboreto de zircônio (ZrB2) é um material que lidera a categoria de cerâmicas de ultra-alta temperatura devido suas propriedades únicas, dentre elas o seu elevado ponto de fusão (3245 °C) e baixa densidade em relação aos demais materiais desta categoria (6,09 g/cm3). SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de produtos de minerais não-metálicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Cerâmicas de diboreto de zircônio (ZrB2) apresentam baixa densidade teórica, elevado ponto de fusão, elevada resistência mecânica e condutividade térmica e elétrica, além de apresentar excelente resistência a corrosão. Esta combinação única de propriedades faz do ZrB2 um promissor candidato para aplicação em sistemas de barreira térmica, ferramentas de corte, eletrodos de alta temperatura e cadinhos para fusão de metais. O presente trabalho tem o objetivo de estudar a densficação do ZrB2 utilizando prensagem a quente, avaliando o efeito da redução do tamanho de partícula do pó inicial e introdução de aditivos de sinterização. Para avaliar a redução do tamanho de partícula, o pó de ZrB2 foi moído em moinho planetário de alta energia por 4h. Foram processadas pastilhas com SiC em concentrações de 10, 20 e 30 % em vol. e amostras com adição de TiO2 e B4C. As pastilhas foram sinterizadas a 1850 ºC/30 min e pressão de 20 MPa em atmosfera de argônio. A amostra sem moagem atingiu apenas 78,7 % da densidade teórica, passando a 88,1 % DT com o pó moído. A presença de aditivos proporcionou uma densificação acima de 94 %DT para todas as demais amostras.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Cerâmicas de diboreto de zircônio (ZrB2) apresentam baixa densidade teórica, elevado ponto de fusão, elevada resistência mecânica e condutividade térmica e elétrica, além de apresentar excelente resistência a corrosão. Esta combinação única de propriedades faz do ZrB2 um promissor candidato para aplicação em sistemas de barreira térmica, ferramentas de corte, eletrodos de alta temperatura e cadinhos para fusão de metais. O presente trabalho tem o objetivo de estudar a densficação do ZrB2 utilizando prensagem a quente, avaliando o efeito da redução do tamanho de partícula do pó inicial e introdução de aditivos de sinterização. A presença de aditivos proporcionou uma densificação acima de 94 %DT para todas as demais amostras.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Titanium is an outstanding material which combines low density with high
strength and good corrosion resistance. For that reason it finds applications in
sensitive areas such as aerospace industry and biomedical components.
Limitations for the widespread use of titanium are basically attributed to its high
cost. Powder metallurgy (PM) is a recognized low cost alternative for the
production of titanium and titanium alloys components. Among the existing PM
techniques, the press-and-sinter route is the one that adds the least cost to the
overall process [1,2]. The aim of this work is to study the obtaining of sintered
titanium from the pressing and direct sintering of titanium hydride powder.
Besides the elimination of the dehydrogenation step, the direct sintering of
titanium hydride enables higher densification and lower interstitial content. The
resulting characteristics of the sintered samples, such as densification, interstitial
content, microstructure and strength were evaluated related the adopted
processing parameters, also focusing on the potential to produce titanium
components according to standard specifications.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The NiTiCu SMA produced by powder metallurgy (PM) is a promising material due to variety of
advantages in practical use. The addition of cooper (Cu), as ternary element, in NiTi SMA Increases the characteristic temperatures of the martensitic transformation, cause good stability of characteristic temperature, good corrosion resistance and reduces of Ti3Ni4 precipitation. When this type of alloy is utilized as biomedical material, such as implants, can be occurs the rejection on the human body. One possibility is the surface modification by Nitrogen Plasma Immersion Ion Implantation (N-PIII) technique. The hardness measure in SMA is important properties because it is a strong indicator of mechanical performance. It is interesting to note that for in NiTiCu SMA the evaluating hardness depends on temperature since the mechanical properties of SMAs are temperature dependent.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Titanium and its alloys show a unique combination of properties, such as high
strength-to-weight ratio, corrosion resistance and biocompatibility. Despite this,
due to its high cost, the use of titanium is usually limited to applications that
require high performance, such as in the manufacturing of aerospace components
and biomedical implants [1]. Powder metallurgy (PM) is a good alternative for
reducing the manufacturing costs of titanium. Its benefits are related to the low
energy consumption, reduced material waste, besides the production of near net
shape parts with microstructural homogeneity. In the conventional PM routes,
compaction of powders is an important step of and it has been widely studied in
order to achieve the highest density with the lowest porosity as possible. This
work is focused on the study of the compaction mechanism of titanium hydride
powders through the use of a theoretical model developed for titanium powders
[2]. Powder samples of 1,0 g with admixed lubricant were uniaxially compacted in
a cylindrical steel die up to 800 MPa using an MTS 810 hydraulic universal
testing machine. The obtained experimental results of densification were plotted
against compaction pressure and well fitted to the equation model. Three
different mechanisms were identified according to the model, including the initial
density, rearrangement (sliding and fracture of the particles), and work hardening
(elastic and plastic deformation). The obtained compaction behavior was related
to SEM images of the green samples compacted at intermediate pressures up to
800 MPa. The fracture and plastic deformation of the particles could be clearly
observed according to the obtained micrographs.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of hydrogenated titanium powders combined with traditional PM techniques may lead to a significant reduction in the manufacturing costs of titanium components. In this work, the advantages and limitations of the use of TiH2 powder consolidated through the conventional pressand-sinter method were investigated. Processing parameters related to the compaction and sintering were studied for a TiH2. The mechanisms involved in the compaction of powders were detailed through the fit of compressibility data to a theoretical model originally developed for titanium powders. Densification of samples was favored by the reduction in particle size and increase in sintering temperature. The positive effects of hydrogen release during dehydrogenation were verified through the results of sintered densities and the reduction of oxygen levels. Limitations were observed mainly regarding the flowability of powders and the difficulty to achieve full densification.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The use of hydrogenated titanium powders combined with traditional PM techniques may lead to a significant reduction in the manufacturing costs of titanium components. Processing parameters related to the compaction and sintering were studied for a TiH2. SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The development of cost-effective techniques for the fabrication of titanium components has been the subject of many studies in the last decades. Titanium powder metallurgy (PM) is recognized as a low cost alternative for the fabrication of titanium components with unique characteristics, such as near net shape, microstructural homogeneity and controlled porosity. Compared to the melting processes, the higher efficiency of PM is mainly attributed to the lower energy consumption and minimization of material wastage. Although the favorable
aspects of titanium hydride powder metallurgy have been reported, few studies have focused on the complete assessment of the process route taking into account its
advantages and limitations. In the present work, the combined use of TiH2 powder with the
conventional press-and-sinter technique was investigated. Consolidation of titanium samples was studied regarding powder characteristics and compaction and sintering parameters. The effects of particle size distribution, admixed lubricant, compaction pressure and sintering temperature were evaluated upon the flowability of powder, compaction mechanisms, densification levels, interstitial elements and microstructure..
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

Titanium powder metallurgy (PM) is recognized as a low cost alternative for the fabrication of titanium components with unique characteristics, such as near net shape, microstructural homogeneity and controlled porosity. Compared to the melting processes, the higher efficiency of PM is mainly attributed to the lower energy consumption and minimization of material wastage. Although the favorable

advantages and limitations. In the present work, the combined use of TiH2 powder with the

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of materials for replacement of bones and damaged tissue has increased in recent years. Titanium alloys exhibit high strength to weight ratio, excellent resistance to fatigue and corrosion, high cryogenic properties and biocompatibility, being the metal most suitable for the manufacture of implants. The development of new alloys aims to provide the best possible functional reconstitution. Reducing the stiffness of the implants obtained by substituting new materials of lower modulus of elasticity improves the redistribution of stress in adjacent bone tissue, minimizing the stress shielding effect and prolonging the useful life of the prosthesis. However, beyond the low elastic modulus, new alloys with Young's modulus self-tunable are being developed to meet the needs of patients and surgeons, as in the case of fixing spinal operations, in which the elastic recovery ("springback"), a higher low modulus materials, makes the appropriate fixation devices. Therefore, this project proposes the development of a production process by powder metallurgy (P/M), of the new alloy of this class, Ti-30Zr-20Nb, for use in implants, but with potential use in the aviation sector. The powder metallurgy (P/M) is a viable alternative, as it allows obtaining parts with complex geometries and close to final dimensions, low running costs, in addition to the accurate control of the chemical composition and high structural uniformity. Alloy samples were produced by a mixture of powders, obtained by hydrogenation followed by uniaxial and cold isostatic pressing and sintering between 800 ° C up to 1400 ° C. The sintered samples were characterized by scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction and density tests and Vickers microhardness. With high sintering temperatures it was possible to obtain the complete dissolution of the alloying elements in titanium matrix, microstructural homogeneity, high densification and increase of microhardness.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de produtos de metal, exceto máquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Gum metal alloy Ti-23Nb-0.7Ta-2Zr-O (%at.) was developed by Saito et al. (2003) based on theoretical calculations. Their aim was to reduce titanium elastic modulus by the addition of β stabilizing elements, such as V, Nb, Ta e Mo. Additionally, the addition of group IV elements provide increased strength without unduly increase in elastic modulus. Gum metal alloy presents unique properties, differing significantly from β traditional alloys; main attributes are: extremely low elastic modulus (40-60 GPa); elastic deformation further than 2.5%; 1200-1600 MPa tensile strength; highly cold workable without work hardening. This investigation aimed to fabricate the alloy by powder metallurgy and to evaluate the microstructure after sintering.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Gum metal alloy Ti-23Nb-0.7Ta-2Zr-O (%at.) was developed by Saito et al. (2003) based on theoretical calculations. Their aim was to reduce titanium elastic modulus by the addition of β stabilizing elements, such as V, Nb, Ta e Mo. Additionally, the addition of group IV elements provide increased strength without unduly increase in elastic modulus. Gum metal alloy presents unique properties, differing significantly from β traditional alloys; main attributes are: extremely low elastic modulus (40-60 GPa); elastic deformation further than 2.5%; 1200-1600 MPa tensile strength; highly cold workable without work hardening. AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: HENRIQUES, V. A. R.;Henriques, Vinicius André Rodrigues;Henriques, V.A.R.;Henriques, Vinícius André Rodrigues;Henriques, Vinicius A. R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Metals are successfully used in many different implants, in particular when it is necessary to bear loads; an example of this is the hip replacement, where Co-Cr-Mo and Ti alloys are used [1]. Titanium are attractive materials for the manufacture of implants for medical applications due to their superior biocompatibility and outstanding corrosion resistance compared with other conventional metallic materials [2,3]. The trend of the current research in orthopaedical implants is based in the development of titanium alloys composed of non-toxic elements like Nb, Ta, Zr, with low density, high strength, and low modulus of elasticity. Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta alloy, with a b-like microstructure, is attractive material for the manufacture of implants due an excellent combination of properties, including high resistance, excellent hot and cold workability and the lowest modulus of elasticity among the titanium alloys. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy eases the obtainment of parts with complex geometry and probably, cheaper [4]. This work analyses the microstructural development of the Ti-35Nb-7Zr-5Ta alloy and the elemental powders behavior during the sintering stage with the temperature increase.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Production of Ti-6%Al-7%Nb alloy by powder metallurgy (P/M)
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Production of Ti-6%Al-7%Nb alloy by powder metallurgy (P/M)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: HENRIQUES, V. A. R.;Henriques, Vinicius André Rodrigues;Henriques, V.A.R.;Henriques, Vinícius André Rodrigues;Henriques, Vinicius A. R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The influence of the processing parameters and chemical composition of the elemental powders on the final microstructure was investigated. Samples of Ti-6Al-7Nb were obtained from uniaxial hot pressing of the elemental powders in vacuum. The pressing was carried out in temperature range 1000-1500 C with pressures from 10 to 25 MPa.The results show high densification, homogeneous chemical composition, high tensile strenght and a Widmanst"a tten-like microstructure.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The influence of the processing parameters and chemical composition of the elemental powders on the final microstructure was investigated. Samples of Ti-6Al-7Nb were obtained from uniaxial hot pressing of the elemental powders in vacuum. The pressing was carried out in temperature range 1000-1500 C with pressures from 10 to 25 MPa.The results show high densification, homogeneous chemical composition, high tensile strenght and a Widmanst"a tten-like microstructure.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Production of Titanium Alloys for Medical Implants by Powder Metallurgy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Production of Titanium Alloys for Medical Implants by Powder Metallurgy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Titanium alloys are expected to be much more widely used for implant materials in the medical and dental fields because of their superior biocompatibillity, corrosion resistance and specific strength compared with other metallic implant materials. Vanadium free alloys like Ti-6Al-7Nb and Ti-5Al-2,5Fe have been recently developed for biomedical use. More recently vanadium and aluminum free alloys composed of non-toxic elements like Nb, Ta, Zr and so on with lower modulus have been started to be developed. The bb type alloys like Ti-15Mo are now the main target for medical materials. A blended elemental titanium powder metallurgy process has been developed to offer low cost products. The process employs hydride-dehydride (HDH) powders and near-net shape techniques. In this work, the influence of the processing parameters and chemical composition of the elementary powders on the final microstructure was investigated. The alloys were characterized by means of scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction, Vickers microhardness measurements, chemical analysis and density. The results indicate that the samples presented high densification, homogeneous chemical composition and coherent microstructures. The process parameters were defined aiming to reduce the interstitial pick-up (O, N) and to avoid the grain growth .
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium alloys are expected to be much more widely used for implant materials in the medical and dental fields because of their superior biocompatibillity, corrosion resistance and specific strength compared with other metallic implant materials. Vanadium free alloys like Ti-6Al-7Nb and Ti-5Al-2,5Fe have been recently developed for biomedical use. More recently vanadium and aluminum free alloys composed of non-toxic elements like Nb, Ta, Zr and so on with lower modulus have been started to be developed. The bb type alloys like Ti-15Mo are now the main target for medical materials. A blended elemental titanium powder metallurgy process has been developed to offer low cost products. The process employs hydride-dehydride (HDH) powders and near-net shape techniques. In this work, the influence of the processing parameters and chemical composition of the elementary powders on the final microstructure was investigated. The alloys were characterized by means of scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction, Vickers microhardness measurements, chemical analysis and density. The results indicate that the samples presented high densification, homogeneous chemical composition and coherent microstructures. The process parameters were defined aiming to reduce the interstitial pick-up (O, N) and to avoid the grain growth .

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: SEM microstructural study of the Ti-6%Al-7%Nb alloy obtained by powder metallurgy

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: HENRIQUES, V. A. R.;Henriques, Vinicius André Rodrigues;Henriques, V.A.R.;Henriques, Vinícius André Rodrigues;Henriques, Vinicius A. R.;Vinicius André Rodrigues Henriques;Vinicius A. R. Henriques;HENRIQUES, V A R;HENRIQUES, VINICIUS A.R.;RODRIGUES HENRIQUES, VINICIUS ANDRÉ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Two-phase (a + b) alloy was commercially developed aiming at the replacement of Ti-6%Al-4%V alloy in the manufacture of surgical implants owing to its best biocompatibility. The alloy processing by powder metallurgy, starting from the elemental or prealloyed powders is a feasible route considering its lower costs, versatility and also the facilities of manufacture parts with complex geometry and near to the final dimensions (?near net shape?). This work analyzes the microstructural development of the Ti-6%Al-7%Nb alloy obtained by powder metallurgy, and the influence of the processing parameters (temperature and compaction pressure) on the final alloy microstructure.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades Físicas dos Metais e Ligas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho tem por objetivo a obtenção e caracterização microestrutural da liga Ti-6Al-7Nb por metalurgia do pó, visando sua utilização em aplicações nos setores aeronáutico e aeroespacial e em próteses biocompatíveis. Foram utilizados pós de titânio oriundos da moagem de esponjas e pós obtidos pelo processo de hidrogenação-desidrogenação (HDH).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Desenvolvimento da Metalurgia do Pó (M/P) em titânio na Indústria Aeronáutica
